speaker: James
text: Hey Sofia, have you finished reviewing the design documents? I noticed there were a few issues last time.
ipa: heɪ soʊˈfiə | həv ju ˈfɪnɪʃt rɪˈvjuɪŋ ðə dɪˈzaɪn ˈdɑkjəmənts | aɪ ˈnoʊtɪst ðɛr wɚ ə fju ˈɪʃuz læst taɪm
stress: HEY SOFIA | HAVE YOU FINISHED REVIEWING THE DESIGN DOCUMENTS | I NOTICED THERE WERE A FEW ISSUES LAST TIME
linking:
"have you" → /həv ju/ (linking v to y)
"finished reviewing" → /ˈfɪnɪʃt rɪˈvjuɪŋ/ (t links to r)
"design documents" → /dɪˈzaɪn ˈdɑkjəmənts/ (n links to d)

speaker: Sofia
text: Yes, I’ve already fixed most of them. There were some diagrams missing, and I added a lot of detail to the architecture section.
ipa: jɛs | aɪv ɔlˈrɛdi fɪkst moʊst əv ðɛm | ðɛr wɚ səm ˈdaɪəˌɡræmz ˈmɪsɪŋ | ənd aɪ ˈædɪd ə lɑt əv ˈdiˌteɪl tə ði ˈɑrkəˌtɛkʧɚ ˈsɛkʃən
stress: YES | I’VE ALREADY FIXED MOST OF THEM | THERE WERE SOME DIAGRAMS MISSING | AND I ADDED A LOT OF DETAIL TO THE ARCHITECTURE SECTION
linking:
"I’ve already" → /aɪv ɔlˈrɛdi/ (v links to vowel)
"added a" → /ˈædɪd ə/ (d links to a)
"detail to" → /ˈdiˌteɪl tə/ (l links to t)

speaker: James
text: That’s great. How much time did you spend on it?
ipa: ðæts ɡreɪt | haʊ mʌʧ taɪm dɪd ju spɛnd ɑn ɪt
stress: THAT’S GREAT | HOW MUCH TIME DID YOU SPEND ON IT
linking:
"did you" → /dɪd ju/ (d links to y)
"spend on" → /spɛnd ɑn/ (d links to o)

speaker: Sofia
text: Not too much actually — just a couple of hours. I reused some templates from the last project, so that helped.
ipa: nɑt tu mʌʧ ˈækʧuəli | ʤəst ə ˈkʌpəl əv ˈaʊɚz | aɪ riˈjuzd səm ˈtɛmpləts frəm ðə læst ˈprɑʤɛkt | soʊ ðæt hɛlpt
stress: NOT TOO MUCH ACTUALLY | JUST A COUPLE OF HOURS | I REUSED SOME TEMPLATES FROM THE LAST PROJECT | SO THAT HELPED
linking:
"just a" → /ʤəst ə/ (t links to a)
"couple of" → /ˈkʌpəl əv/ (l links to v)
"that helped" → /ðæt hɛlpt/ (t links to h)

speaker: James
text: Nice thinking. Did you check if any features are still pending?
ipa: naɪs ˈθɪŋkɪŋ | dɪd ju ʧɛk ɪf ˈɛni ˈfiʧɚz ɑr stɪl ˈpɛndɪŋ
stress: NICE THINKING | DID YOU CHECK IF ANY FEATURES ARE STILL PENDING
linking:
"did you" → /dɪd ju/ (d links to y)
"features are" → /ˈfiʧɚz ɑr/ (z links to a)

speaker: Sofia
text: Yeah, there are a few features that still need to be finalized. Especially the search filter — I think it needs some more testing.
ipa: jæ | ðɛr ɑr ə fju ˈfiʧɚz ðæt stɪl nid tə bi ˈfaɪnəˌlaɪzd | əˈspɛʃəli ðə sɝʧ ˈfɪltɚ | aɪ θɪŋk ɪt nidz səm mɔr ˈtɛstɪŋ
stress: YEAH | THERE ARE A FEW FEATURES THAT STILL NEED TO BE FINALIZED | ESPECIALLY THE SEARCH FILTER | I THINK IT NEEDS SOME MORE TESTING
linking:
"need to" → /nid tə/ (d links to t)
"think it" → /θɪŋk ɪt/ (k links to i)

speaker: James
text: Let’s talk to the QA team then. Maybe they can handle it by tomorrow.
ipa: lɛts tɔk tə ðə ˌkjuˈeɪ tim ðɛn | ˈmeɪbi ðeɪ kən ˈhændəl ɪt baɪ təˈmɑroʊ

"handle it" → /ˈhændəl ɪt/ (l links to i)

speaker: Sofia
text: Sure. I’ll send them an update right after this call. Also, did you talk to our new intern?
ipa: ʃʊr | aɪl sɛnd ðɛm ən ˈʌpˌdeɪt raɪt ˈæftɚ ðɪs kɔl | ˈɔlsoʊ | dɪd ju tɔk tə aʊɚ nu ˈɪnˌtɝn

speaker: James
text: Yes, he's great! His code was clean, and he asked a lot of questions, which I really appreciate.
ipa: jɛs | hiz ɡreɪt | hɪz koʊd wəz klin | ənd hi æskt ə lɑt əv ˈkwɛsʧənz | wɪʧ aɪ ˈrɪli əˈpriʃiˌeɪt

speaker: Sofia
text: Awesome. We could ask him to document the API endpoints. That way, everyone on the team can benefit from it.
ipa: ˈɔsəm | wi kəd æsk hɪm tə ˈdɑkjəmənt ði ˌeɪpiˈaɪ ˈɛndˌpɔɪnts | ðæt weɪ | ˈɛvrɪˌwʌn ɑn ðə tim kən ˈbɛnəfɪt frəm ɪt
stress: AWESOME | WE COULD ASK HIM TO DOCUMENT THE API ENDPOINTS | THAT WAY | EVERYONE ON THE TEAM CAN BENEFIT FROM IT
linking:
"ask him" → /æsk hɪm/ (k links to h)
"benefit from" → /ˈbɛnəfɪt frəm/ (t links to f)

speaker: James
text: Exactly. Let’s make sure each module has at least some basic documentation. Even a little information helps in the long run.
ipa: ɪɡˈzæktli | lɛts meɪk ʃʊr itʃ ˈmɑʤul hæz æt list səm ˈbeɪsɪk ˌdɑkjəˌmɛnˈteɪʃən | ˈivən ə ˈlɪtl ˌɪnfɚˈmeɪʃən hɛlps ɪn ðə lɔŋ rʌn
stress: EXACTLY | LET’S MAKE SURE EACH MODULE HAS AT LEAST SOME BASIC DOCUMENTATION | EVEN A LITTLE INFORMATION HELPS IN THE LONG RUN

"each module" → /itʃ ˈmɑʤul/ (ch links to m)

speaker: Sofia
text: Totally agree. I’ll get started on my part, and I’ll let you know if I run into anything.
ipa: ˈtoʊtəli əˈɡri | aɪl ɡɛt ˈstɑrtɪd ɑn maɪ pɑrt | ənd aɪl lɛt ju noʊ ɪf aɪ rʌn ˈɪntu ˈɛniˌθɪŋ

speaker: James
text: Perfect. Thanks again — your help always makes a difference.
